block.p: Teresa I-Hsin Lin and Craig Fairhurst Knight were married yesterday in Manhattan. The Rev. Paul S. Fiddes performed the Episcopal ceremony at the Eleven Madison Park restaurant.

Ms. Lin, 37, was until March an executive director for corporate finance at UBS Warburg, the investment bank, in New York. She graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and received an M.B.A. from the University of Chicago. She is a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Shin-R Lin of Glen Cove, N.Y. Her father is a professor of physics at the New York Institute of Technology at Old Westbury. Her mother, Agnes L. Lin, retired as a senior software engineer in Melville, N.Y., with Northrop Grumman Norden Systems, the military contractors.

Mr. Knight, 44, is a partner in Knight, Tallman & Company, an investment banking concern in Darien, Conn. He received undergraduate and law degrees from Oxford University in England, and a master of laws degree from New York University. He is also the treasurer of the board of the Saddle River (N.J.) Day School, a private preparatory school. He is a son of Ruth S. Knight of Carlstadt, N.J., and the late G. R. Knight. His mother retired as a secretary at Berlin & Jones, an envelope manufacturer in East Rutherford, N.J. His father retired as the general manager of the Knapp Chemical Company of Garfield, N.J., a manufacturer of preparations used by the pharmaceutical industry.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
